Package edu.sru.thangiah.webrouting.controller

Class MaintenanceOrderController

java.lang.Object
edu.sru.thangiah.webrouting.controller.MaintenanceOrderController
@Controller public class MaintenanceOrderController extends Object
Handles the Thymeleaf controls for the pages dealing with Maintenance Orders.
Since:
2/8/2022
Author:
Ian Black imb1007@sru.edu

      Instantiates the techniciansRepository
      Parameters:
      maintenanceOrderRepository - Used to interact with maintenance orders in the database
      techniciansRepository - Used to interact with technicians in the database

  • Method Details

    • showMaintenanceOrdersList

      @RequestMapping("/maintenanceorders") public String showMaintenanceOrdersList(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Adds all of the maintenance orders to the "maintenanceOrder" model and redirects user to the maintenanceorders page.
      Parameters:
      model - Used to add data to the model
      Returns:
      "maintenanceorders"

    • showOrderList

      @GetMapping("/add-maintenance") public String showOrderList(org.springframework.ui.Model model, MaintenanceOrders maintenanceOrder, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)
      Redirects user to the /add/add-maintenance page
      Parameters:
      model - Used to add data to the model
      maintenanceOrder - Used to store information on the maintenance order
      result - Ensures the user inputs are valid
      Returns:
      "/add/add-maintenance"

    • addMaintenanceOrder

      @RequestMapping("/addmaintenance") public String addMaintenanceOrder(@Validated MaintenanceOrders maintenanceOrder, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Adds a maintenance order to the database. Checks if there are errors in the form.
      If there are no errors, the order is saved in the maintenanceOrderRepository. and the user is redirect to /maintenanceorders
      If there are errors, the user is redirected to the /add/add-maintenance page.
      Parameters:
      maintenanceOrder - Stores information on the maintenance order that is added
      result - Ensures the user
      model - Used to add data to the model
      Returns:
      "redirect:/maintenanceorders" or "/add/add-maintenance"

    • deleteMaintenance

      @GetMapping("/deleteorder/{id}") public String deleteMaintenance(@PathVariable("id") long id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Finds a maintenance order using the id parameter and if found, redirects to confirmation page
      Parameters:
      id - Stores the ID of the maintenance order to be deleted
      model - Used to add data to the model
      Returns:
      "redirect:/maintenanceorders"

    • deleteOrderConfirmation

      @GetMapping("/deleteorderconfirmation/{id}") public String deleteOrderConfirmation(@PathVariable("id") long id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Finds an order using the id parameter and if found, deletes the order and redirects to orders page
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the order being deleted
      model - Used to add data to the model
      Returns:
      "redirect:/maintenanceorders"

    • showEditForm

      @GetMapping("/editorder/{id}") public String showEditForm(@PathVariable("id") long id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Finds a maintenance order using the id parameter and if found, adds the details of that maintenance order to a form and redirects the user to that update form.
      Also adds the technicians, drivers, and vehicles to the form.
      Parameters:
      id - Stores the ID of the maintenance order to be edited
      model - Used to add data to the model
      Returns:
      "update/update-maintenance"

    • updateOrder

      @PostMapping("/updateorder/{id}") public String updateOrder(@PathVariable("id") long id, @Validated MaintenanceOrders maintenanceOrder, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Updates a maintenance order to the database. Checks if there are errors in the form.
      If there are no errors, the maintenance order is updated in the maintenanceOrderRepository and the user is redirect to /maintenanceorders
      If there are errors, the user is redirected to the /update/update-maintenance page.
      Parameters:
      id - Stores the ID of the maintenance order that is being updated
      maintenanceOrder - Stores the information on the maintenance order being updated
      result - Ensures the inputs from the user are valid
      model - Used to add data to the model
      Returns:
      "redirect:/locations" or "/update/update-location"

    • getLoggedInUser

      public User getLoggedInUser()
      Returns the user that is currently logged into the system.
      If there is no user logged in, null is returned.
      Returns:
      user2 or null
